defects.description: Error message 'AI not configured. Set VITE_AI_PROXY_URL or VITE_CLAUDE_API_KEY.' leaks environment variable names to end users

JSON parsing of AI response uses greedy regex with no structural validation. The regex `/\{[\s\S]*\}/` greedily matches the first '{' to the last '}' in the response, which can capture malformed or ne

The suggestViolationFix function returns AI-generated accessibility remediation advice without any disclaimer that the content is AI-generated and should be verified by a qualified accessibility speci

The generateCompliancePlan function asks the LLM to generate specific remediation timelines ('1-2 weeks'), expected improvement percentages ('+15% compliance'), and resource requirements without groun
defects.fix_approach: Add disclaimers; remove specific percentages from prompts

defects.description: Multiple AI service files hardcode different Claude model versions without centralized model configuration. aiSuggestionService.js uses 'claude-sonnet-4-20250514' (line 70), metaGeneratorService.js us
defects.skip_reason: AI services hardcode different model versions
defects.fix_approach: Centralize model config in single module

ReadabilityShareView is a public-facing shared analysis page (no auth required) but has no SEOHead, no OG tags, no Twitter cards, and no meta description. When users share analysis links on social med

ReadabilityShareView has heading hierarchy violations. The page starts with an h1 ('AI Readability Report') at line 168, then has h2 elements for sections (lines 219, 234, 281, 314, 345), but the erro

Public shared analysis view displays LLM coverage data (model names, content/headings/entities coverage percentages, usefulness scores) without any AI-generated content disclaimer. The AIDisclaimer co

The getGradeFromScore function in the share view uses different grade boundaries than those used in the main application's gradeMapper utility (imported in ReadabilityScoreCard.jsx line 3). This means
The ReadabilityShareView is a public-facing page (no auth required) that loads shared analysis reports. When PDF export fails on this public page, the error is only logged to console.error (line 98).

The ReadabilityShareView's PDF export button (handleExportPDF at line 93-100) catches errors but only logs them to console. There is no user-facing error notification if the PDF export fails. Unlike o

There is an inconsistency in the category taxonomy used for readability analysis across different components. ReadabilityWeightConfig defines categories as 'contentStructure', 'contentClarity', 'techn
Generated OG meta tags missing og:image property - the generateHtmlCode function never outputs og:image even though the metadata object may contain image data
Generated Twitter Card meta tags missing twitter:image property - social previews will have no image on Twitter/X
Generated HTML includes deprecated meta keywords tag which is ignored by Google and may signal spam to search engines
Static meta title fallback uses firstSentence.slice(0, 50) without checking for mid-word truncation, potentially producing broken titles

The generateMetadata function truncates input text to 15,000 characters using a naive `text.slice(0, 15000)` call that may cut content mid-word, mid-sentence, or mid-paragraph. This truncation does no

The parseMetadataResponse function does not validate that the AI-generated meta title and description actually conform to the length requirements specified in the prompt (title: 50-60 chars, descripti
The PDF extraction function loads the pdf.js web worker from an external CDN (cdnjs.cloudflare.com) at runtime using a protocol-relative URL. This creates multiple deployment risks: (1) the CDN could

The Vite build configuration raises the chunkSizeWarningLimit to 600KB (line 25), which is 3x the default 200KB limit. The comment says 'Increase warning limit since we have lazy loading,' but this ef

The Vite build configuration does not explicitly configure output file naming with content hashes for assets beyond the default. While Vite does add hashes to JS chunks by default, there is no explici
defects.skip_reason: No explicit content hash for long-term caching
defects.fix_approach: Configure Vite hashFunction for deterministic hashing

The chunkSizeWarningLimit is set to 600KB, which is 20% above Vite's default of 500KB. The comment states 'Increase warning limit since we have lazy loading', but this masks genuine bundle size proble

The Vite build configuration sets chunkSizeWarningLimit to 600KB (line 25), which suppresses warnings for chunks up to 600KB. The default Vite limit is 500KB, and the stated reason is 'since we have l

The manualChunks configuration in vite.config.js includes 'htmlparser2' and 'franc' in the 'vendor-readability' chunk (line 20), but these libraries are used exclusively by the readability analysis fe
defects.skip_reason: manualChunks groups readability-only libs into shared chunk

Every relatedTerms entry in the glossary references terms that do not exist as glossary entries. Out of 30 glossary terms, the relatedTerms arrays collectively reference 39 unique term names (such as
defects.fix_approach: Add referenced terms or remove broken refs

defects.description: The glossary term 'Title Tag' (id 26) uses the example '<title>Best Running Shoes 2024 - Reviews & Buying Guide</title>' with the year 2024. Given the system is deployed in 2026, this example is stale

The glossary contains only 30 terms for an SEO content strategy portal that features 353 checklist items across 25 categories and includes specialized tools for accessibility (WCAG), readability, sche
defects.skip_reason: Glossary has only 30 terms — insufficient scope

defects.description: The glossaryCategories array contains only 8 categories ('Fundamentals', 'On-Page SEO', 'Technical SEO', 'Content Strategy', 'Performance', 'Off-Page SEO', 'Metrics', 'International SEO'), but glossar

The glossaryCategories array includes categories that do not match the full set of categories actually assigned to glossary terms. The categories 'SERP Features', 'Link Building', and 'Content Quality

The glossary entry for 'Core Web Vitals' (id 4) references 'INP (interactivity)' as the current interactivity metric, which is correct for WCAG 2.2 era. However, the Title Tag entry (id 26) contains '
defects.fix_approach: Update to current year; add dynamic generation

defects.description: Multiple dynamic Tailwind CSS class names constructed via string interpolation throughout the component (e.g., bg-${scoreColor}-100, text-${scoreColor}-600, bg-${trend.color}-100). These will be purge
The useEffect for checking schedule conflicts has eslint-disable-next-line for exhaustive deps. checkConflicts function is defined inside the component body and not memoized, but is excluded from the

The delete confirmation subtitle says 'This action can be undone' when it should say 'This action cannot be undone'. The word 'not' is missing, completely reversing the intended warning meaning. The a

The stats label says 'Pages Scanned' within the Technical Audit tool, which elsewhere uses 'audited' terminology (e.g., 'Audit Page', 'AuditHistoryPanel'). This continues the scan/audit terminology in
The close button (X icon) in the Create/Edit Audit Schedule modal lacks an aria-label attribute. Screen readers will not announce the purpose of this button.

The AuditScheduleFormModal has a 3-step wizard but allows skipping directly to any step by clicking the step indicator bars (lines 851-862). The handleSubmit validates required fields (name, url, cate
defects.fix_approach: Add required field checks before Next

defects.description: The sortedData computation on lines 58-68 is not wrapped in useMemo. It performs array spread and sort on every render, even when data, sortCol, and sortDir have not changed.
Column header 'Time' is ambiguous and lacks a unit or clarification. Users cannot tell if this is processing time, response time, or total analysis time, nor what unit is expected.
Column header 'Entities %' uses NLP/SEO jargon. Most content strategists would not immediately know what 'entities' means in this context (named entities extracted by AI models).
Column headers in the coverage table use inconsistent label formats: 'Content %', 'Headings %', 'Entities %' use suffix-percent notation, while 'Usefulness' and 'Time' have no unit indicator. The 'AI

Sortable table column headers use onClick on <th> elements but are not keyboard accessible. The <th> elements have no tabIndex, role='button', or onKeyDown handler, so keyboard-only users cannot trigg

The data table lacks an accessible name. While it has role='table', there is no aria-label or aria-labelledby linking it to the 'Coverage Comparison' heading above, so screen readers announce it as an

In analyzeUrl, the abort signal is read from abortControllerRef.current at line 454 before runAnalysis creates a new AbortController at line 309. If analyzeUrl is called twice rapidly, the second call
Error message 'AI proxy URL not configured. Set VITE_AI_PROXY_URL in your environment.' exposes internal environment variable names to end users
Error message 'Failed to fetch URL content' uses technical HTTP terminology rather than user-friendly language
The analysis state machine exposes 6 granular internal states (idle, fetching, extracting, analyzing, scoring, error) directly to UI consumers. This creates unnecessary cognitive complexity for users
defects.skip_reason: Analysis state machine exposes 6 internal states to UI
defects.fix_approach: Create simplified loading/ready/error mapping for UI

defects.description: Analysis progress callback (handleProgress) updates state with stage and message but provides no aria-live announcement mechanism. The multi-step analysis pipeline (fetching, extracting, analyzing, sc
defects.skip_reason: Analysis progress no aria-live for screen readers

defects.description: The enforceStorageLimit function auto-deletes the oldest analyses when the storage limit is exceeded, but this happens silently with no user notification or confirmation. Users lose historical analysi
defects.skip_reason: Auto-deletes oldest analyses silently on limit
defects.fix_approach: Show notification before deletion; let user choose
